Key: (And so I left the house with Maria...)

This really seems too early. I don't see a
single student walking to class.
Hee hee.
Maria, you seem like you're having fun.

Yes. It is not much of anything, but it feels
quite nice. The morning air, the birds chirping,
people walking by. I feel... strangely excited.
I see. I think I know what you mean.

(Morning walks with a cool breeze are so
nice, after all.)

If we go this way, we'll make it to school in
no time. It's still early. Wanna take a detour
or something?
Yes. Please show the way, Shido.

(We headed down a different road from
the one we usually took to school.)
Please look, Shido. There is a cat.

(Maria was staring at a cat, curled into a ball
and loafing upon the fence.)
Yep, that's a cat. Must be someone's pet.

If I'm not mistaken, there's another one
right there?
Hmm. Ah, you're right. There it is.

Please look up, Shido. It seems to be
looking at a bird.

I wonder if it's on alert. Well, that's not
too unusual.

Is that so? For me however, every view is
new and exciting.
Really? Then I'm glad we left early.

Yes. This has been a sublime experience.
Had we walked with a group, I wouldn't have
the chance to take in all of my surroundings.

(Maria has a childlike sense of wonder as she
admires the sights around her. It's kind of
charming. I'm having fun just watching her.)
...Shido? Is something the matter?
No, you just seem to be enjoying yourself.
Is that strange?

It's not strange. Not strange at all. When I'm
with you, Maria, I also discover new things,
and it's fun to see.
Is that true...?

Totally. Walking to class is an everyday thing
for me, but I don't mind it when I'm with you.
I see. So this is a typical occurrence for you.

Yep, but that's why I said that being with
you gives me the opportunity to see it from
a new perspective.

It is true that, when walking on my own, I
could feel something transcending mere
observation. It is all thanks to you, Shido.

When you are near, you teach me things I
could never imagine. Even if I knew about them,
through your eyes, I understand them better.

This is... just a guess. There's a lot of things
you know, Maria, but maybe, there isn't a lot
you know about yourself, huh?
About... myself?

Your smile is wonderful. You know how to
be happy and carefree. But even though you
can, you didn't until now. Maybe that's why?
That is one way of looking at things.

Yeah, it's weird. All it takes is a new frame
of mind, or a friend to show you the way,
to see a whole new world.
A whole... new world?

Yeah, that's right. We can change the world.
If you need a new start, just do it. It's not a
new world you're noticing. It's a new you.

What a poetic expression. I don't understand
it fully.

You don't have to understand it right away.
But you'll get it eventually, Maria.
Um, let's see. Are you liking school?
Yes. It is very interesting... No.

It is fun. At least I think it is fun. Through
talking with others, I tell them about myself,
and I learn about them. It is so exciting.

If that's how you feel Maria, then I'm sure
you'll understand. There's so much you don't
know waiting for you. So many new things.

Yes. I wish to learn more. So that one day,
I can understand love.

Yeah. I'll help you out too, Maria. Everyone
else is there for you, too.

Yes. Thank you. There are still many things
I have yet to understand about this world.
So I won't let you escape, okay?
I hope that's just a joke... Haha.

(In reality, there's no escape from this world,
and we haven't found a way out. But I'm aware
that's not what she means.)

Now then Shido, I would like to take another
detour, so would you accompany me?
Hm? Where are we going?
The park. There is something I am interested in.

The park? Well, we still have time, so stopping
by shouldn't be a problem.
Thank you. Then let us go, Shido.
So, what are you gonna do?
Would you like to take a small break?

(As Maria said this, she pointed towards
a bench set up within the park.)
A break?

I wanted to see how it looked in the early
morning.
That's all?
Yes. That is all.

So that's what you wanted...
Well, it's a lovely view after all.
Yes.

(Maria trotted excitedly towards the bench,
and slowly sat herself down.)
The breeze is so nice.
It is.

(As Maria sat beneath the soft sunlight peeking
through the trees, she was enveloped in a sort
of bright, ethereal aura.)

(Although she was just sitting on a bench in
a non-descript park, it had a certain beauty
to it. Almost like a painting.)
Won't you sit down, Shido?
Yeah. I'll be here watching you, Maria.

(Now that I think about it, I felt surprised
that I wanted to sit beside her. I'd never been
taken by such a simple feeling like that.)

(No, maybe I can relate. There was a time
when everything felt new to me, when life
was full of surprises. Anyone can relate.)

(Watching the ever frank and straightforward
Maria, I start feeling somewhat nostalgic.)

I want to show her more. Maria... you'll see
it all.
Is something wrong, Shido?

No... We should get going, Maria. If we stay
for too long, we might be late.
You are right. Let us head to school.

(Maria stood up from the bench, and walked
over to me.)
Hey, Maria?
Yes, what is it?
Let's experience more things together.
...Yes.
Looks like we made it just in time.

Yes. I am relieved to see we were not late.
Had we not been careful, you would have
been in great danger, Shido.

D-Danger... I mean, the civic guidance teacher
is kinda scary, but not dangerous.

No, that is not what I mean. I was referring to
Tohka Yatogami and the others asking for your
reason for being late.

Ohhh, I get it now. I'm glad it didn't end up like
that. Actually, would you even call this a date?

Is this... not a date? It was my understanding
that spending time together this morning was
a date.
Yeah, you're right. This is a proper date.

(If we put it like that, it's a little
embarrassing.)
Wait. Hm? I see people over there...
Shido! What are you doing?!
Tohka! And everyone else...!

How unexpected to find you here of all places.
I'd heard you left early for school because you
were on duty, but...

Suspicion. What reason do you have for walking
with Arusu?

(We even left from our house early and
everything, and we still ran into them at
the gates...)
Umm. This is...
Shido-kun. It's no use. Did you possibly leave\nwith Arusu-chan without telling everyone?
Sharp as always with this kind of stuff, Yoshinon.
What is the meaning of this, Shido-san?
Kurumi. As usual, perfect timing on your end.

Darling, you're terrible. I went to your house
to meet you, and I was told you had already left.
To think you were on a date with Arusu-san!
Miku, too...
Shido. I request an explanation.

Y-You too, Origami...? Even if you had asked
for an explanation—well, you know...

We snuck out because we were scared
of this sort of situation.

Your timing is terrible. At this rate, you'll
be late. You know? That's how it is, so I'm
going in first.
Ah. Hey, Kotori?!
(You're not going to help me?!)

If I'm being completely honest, I'm just doing
whatever might get us out of this world, okay?

I do understand the situation somewhat.
As compensation, let's make an agreement
that you will eat lunch together with me.

He'll be having lunch together with me.
Then I'll forgive you, darling.
No. Eat luncheon together with me, Shido!
Wait. The Yamai Sisters must stand up here.

Promise. Do not be swayed by the others'
sweet talk. Let's have lunch as us three.

Hmmhmhm, Shido-san. Don't you think your mind
won't be at ease with the others? Well, how
would you like to eat lunch alone, with just me?
Um. Um, Shido-san...
Now's your chance, Yoshino! Use your authority\nas a teacher, and call out Shido-kun during\nlunch! Then you can have him all to yourself!

Y-You guys! If you would just let me explain,
then you'd understand!

Hey hey, look. They're having a lovers' quarrel
right at the front gates, this early in the
morning.
Is he trying to flaunt it? How awful.
That's totally gross.

Rgh. Perfect of you to show up too! Either
way, right now, we're gonna be late. Let's
head to class already!
Wha! Wait up, Shido!

(Without looking back at the people calling
at me, I left the scene in a hurry.)
